CADETS Act
Changing Age-Determined Eligibility To Student Incentive Payments Act
A bill to modify the age requirement for the Student Incentive Payment Program of the State maritime academies.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Cantwell with an amendment. With written report No. 118-22.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 60.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Bergman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 467.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Bergman objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

bill.summary:
Changing Age-Determined Eligibility To Student Incentive Payments Act or the CADETS Act
This act modifies the age requirements for the Student Incentive Payment Program, which provides financial support to cadets who attend one of six state maritime academies and commit to a post-graduation service obligation.
Specifically, the act modifies the age requirements to allow older cadets to qualify for the program if they will meet the age requirements for enlistment or commission in the Navy Reserve at the time of their graduation. Current age requirements prohibit cadets older than 25 from participating in the program.
